main event: A civilian observed a reddish-silver, circular object about half the size of a small airplane over Roscoe, New York on September 6, 1966.
interesting points: The object gave off a bluish-greenish trail from all parts.
The object was observed for 3-4 minutes at an altitude of 1000 feet.
The object suddenly went behind some clouds and disappeared.
The weather conditions were partly cloudy with thunderstorms reported in the area.
No photographs or physical evidence were obtained.
